body.name: Shark HP152 NeverChange Air Purifier, 5-year filter, save $300+ in filter replacements, Large Room, 650sq. ft., Odor Neutralizer Technology, captures 99.98% of particles, dust, smells, Charcoal Grey
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 17 hrs 43 mins
features: NEVERCHANGE FILTRATION: HEPA filtration that won’t need replacement*. Debris Defense filter protects HEPA layers ,*for up to 5 years, Tested to GB/T18801-2015 P.CCM, based on 50% CADR declined, 300SQFT, and 12 hrs daily operation on MAX fan speed.

$300+ IN FILTER REPLACEMENT SAVINGS: With NeverChange filtration, you won’t need replacement filters for up to 5 years. *Vs.cost of replacing filters on a competitor unit over 5-year period in 300 square foot space.

DEBRIS DEFENSE PROTECTION: Pulls in large particles like hair, dust, and dander, preventing buildup on your HEPA filter and maximizing performance. Easily remove the screens and vacuum, wipe, or rinse it clean in seconds.
LARGE ROOM COVERAGE: Purify large areas—up to 650 sq. ft. in just one hour. Perfect for bedrooms, kitchens, living rooms, basements, and more. Based on AHAM AC-1, at one air change per hour.

FRESH-SMELLING HOME: Odor Neutralizer Technology guards against odors throughout your home, releasing a fresh scent, delivering 2x better odor reduction vs. filtration alone. *Based on ASTM E544 vs. HP150 with filter and carbon only, after 30 minutes.

EXCEEDS HEPA STANDARDS: Anti-Allergen HEPA filter captures more micropollutants than HEPA standards require, trapping 99.98% of large, small, & micro-sized particles (based on EST-RP-CC007.3, 0.1–0.2 microns). *Allergen refers to non-living matter.

AUTOMATICALLY ADJUSTS: Clean Sense IQ tracks air quality and constantly adjusts power to maintain clean air in your home. (Measures three particle sizes: PM1, PM2.5, and PM10). Results & updates are displayed in real-time on an LED screen.
FOR A GOOD NIGHT'S SLEEP: Ultra-quiet performance, with dimmable lights for minimal sleep interruption.
WHATS INCLUDED: Shark NeverChange Air Purifier, Debris Defense Washable Filter & NeverChange HEPA filter, Odor Neutralizer Cartridge
body.description: Shark NeverChange Air Purifier, saves you $300 or more in filter replacement costs over 5 years*. Covers up to 650sq. ft., for powerful purification. Odor Neutralizer Technology guards against odors throughout your home, releasing a fresh scent. A HEPA filter captures 99.98% of particles. *Vs. cost of replacing filters on a competitor unit over 5-year period in 300 sqft space.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good but expensive air purifier
reviews.reviewText: I’m Huge on air-purifiers, I have 4 at home.What's NOT Included: For $250 it's a bit expensive for these not included.-A remote!!! You have to purchase as an add-on accessory.-Indoor Temperature, Relative Humidity displayed-VOCs, NO2 sensors (not a deal breaker)-It does NOT oscillate but the fan is very strong.-You cannot monitor air quality or remote control device via app. It’s not WiFi-connected.What’s Included and my review:I’ve had the purifier on auto-mode for 4 days in the bedroom and my office. I feel pretty firm on how I feel.1. It didn’t have clear instructions - just a quick start guide. You will need to scan the QR code for full instructions.2. The touch is very responsive and impressive.3. A dust screen to protect the HEPA filter, similar to any other air purifier (in my opinion-ie Honeywell, Dyson). Extra external ‘cage’ to catch dust and needs to vacuumed but should notify you when.4. This HEPA filter is not reusable, nor washable, it will need to be replaced and its suppose to last 5 years. It needs to vacuumed. I will absolutely come back and update how long the filter last. One of my non-brand purifier filter lasted 4 years by vacuuming. I’m sure this will too, if maintained.5. The Odor Neutralizer - it smells like floral and unnatural. I immediately had a headache opening it in the package. I put it in, left it in for 30 on “off” but the smell still lingers on off mode. Giving me a starting headache during my work day. I took this out. It’s similar to an air diffuser. Not a fan.I noticed how clean the bedroom/office was within the first hour comparing to my Honeywell. very Impressive. Amazing air detection- your cooking, he toots or he hits a pen in the other room, this thing kicks on max gear auto mode, in between 3 walls in my apt. Its amazing.MAX fan moves the air very well in the bedroomCONS:Its loud. MAX is as loud as the fan in bathroom or stove fan. It’s very notable loud when it switches fan settings.What’s even more annoying is the fan on auto when it switches back and forth. Its like the sensors are uncertain meaning whatever setting your looking at ex: air quality percentage.. it’ll drop to 83%-yellow at medium fan, then switch to 86% at MAX fan. The fan switches back and forth, the percentage goes up/down/up down until it stabilizing. My Dyson is constant and fan decreases, as it cleans the air and quieter.Cannot fall asleep or difficult work when it suddenly switches back and forth! But you get use to it.I tested this when I was cooking dinner, we compared to my Dyson, please see pictures for more info. It’s pretty much 1-1 almost (not AQ!)I don’t know if others experience the same cons. butI love love my Dyson purifier. I'm really in love my shark vacuum.and I like this purifier. I wish it had the temps displayed.2 week Update- as an air purifier I’m very satisfied with the overall AQ. I don’t need my inhaler as much at night (I had the 6 year honeywell in here). Plus the screens to collect dust— I removed these after 2 weeks exactly running it on auto, you’d be surprised with how much it collected!! Impressiveair suction.I’ve gotten used to the fan noise when I’m sleeping.During work it’s kinda noticeable without background noise.I have walked into it a few times since it’s on the floor lol.It’s great, but expensive. I still like it (a lot now) —impressive AQ.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A really wonderful air purifier and cleans air well
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I've been using this air purifier for a few weeks now and it is a great product and very accurate.This air purifier is amazing. It will measure three particle sizes: PM1, PM2.5, and PM10 and you look at the main display on the front and you can cycle for a reading on what it is reading in the air for the three particle sizes or an overall general clean air score from 1% - 100%.There are filters on the side that need to be cleaned that will catch hair and other larger debris.The air purifier will read the air quality continuously in auto mode will adjust the power to clean if it senses the air quality has degraded.For background - I have another air purifier in the house and when there is smoke from cooking or other particles in the air, it kicks on high to clear it. This air purifier is in another room and when the other air purifier kicks on to clear the air, the Shark also notices particles and will display it on the front and kick on higher to clear it.When you plug this air purifier in it is very quick to come back with a reading of air quality and adjust power accordingly.This air purifier is very quiet on it's normal mode. If the air quality degrades the fan will kick on higher to clear the air and at that point it is louder. You are able to take the air purifier off auto and adjust the speed as needed.If you use this air purifier in your room at night, you can adjust the brightness of the display to bright, dim and off. This is awesome if you love to sleep with a dark room but you still want an air purifier to clean the air.The box said it comes with a remote. The product description doesn't say it comes with a remote. I reached out to Shark, who sent a remote at no cost, but it was not the correct remote for this unit and did not work. So I'm not really sure if it has a remote made for this unit?It doesn't connect via WIFI or to an app but I'm not sure that is necessary.I did NOT use the odor cartridge. It has a bunch of warning labels on do not touch it with bare hands etc and when I did open it, the scent was very strong. I decided not to use it at all in my unit.Overall, I love this unit. I think it does a great job reading air quality and cleaning the air.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well as an air purifier. The odor neutralizer scent is not great.
reviews.reviewText: We've got 3 dogs and I was looking for a way to reduce the smells in our living room (the room we spend the most amount of time in). This air purifier has done a great job with that. It's pretty quiet, even when the fan is running. It was easy to set up and get running. I like that there are mesh screens you can brush off or vacuum off, to get rid of any big stuff (like dog fur). And the "never change" filter looks pretty great. I was hesitant to get an air purifier before, because the maintenance requirements seemed cumbersome. But this is very easy.My only complaint is the odor neutralizer packet has a scent that reminds me of cheap bathroom air freshener, from a gas station or fast food bathroom. It's not a very sophisticated scent. I'm hoping maybe there are other options I can buy to replace it when the time comes, that will smell a bit nicer. Even a standard vanilla would be better than this scent.
